skill.name: executing-plans
skill.description: Execute implementation plans with batch processing and review checkpoints. Use when given a plan document.
skill.summary: Execute implementation plans with batch processing and review checkpoints. Use when given a plan doc...
skill.author: DMJGilbert

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown instructions. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, and no external command execution. The skill provides structured guidance for executing implementation plans with built-in quality checkpoints.

content.user_title: Execute implementation plans with quality gates
content.value_statement: Implementing complex plans without checkpoints leads to accumulated errors and wasted work. This skill enforces systematic execution with batch processing, verification steps, and human review points between work chunks.
actual_capabilities: Load and review plan documents for ambiguities
Execute tasks in configurable batch sizes (default 3)
Run verifications after each task completion
Report batch progress with pass/fail details
Stop and escalate blockers for clarification
limitations: Requires a pre-existing plan document to follow
Does not create plans from scratch (use writing-plans skill)
Depends on user to provide feedback at checkpoints

use_cases.title: Feature implementation
use_cases.description: Execute multi-step feature implementations with built-in testing and review checkpoints

use_cases.title: Team workflow coordination
use_cases.description: Oversee systematic implementation with quality gates and progress reporting

use_cases.title: Autonomous task execution
use_cases.description: Structured execution of complex tasks with verification and error handling

prompt_templates.title: Start simple plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the executing-plans skill to implement this plan. Start with the first batch of 3 tasks.

prompt_templates.title: Complex work batches
prompt_templates.scenario: Working on high-risk or complex implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: Execute this plan with batch size of 1. Run full verification after each task and report results.

prompt_templates.title: Continue after feedback
prompt_templates.scenario: After user review of previous batch
prompt_templates.prompt: Based on the feedback provided, continue executing the plan with the next batch. Apply the requested changes first.

prompt_templates.title: Complete and finalize
prompt_templates.scenario: All tasks in the plan are finished
prompt_templates.prompt: Finalize the implementation: run the complete test suite, verify all requirements are met, and announce completion with summary.

output_examples.input: Execute this plan to add user authentication. The plan has 8 tasks total.
output: Tasks Completed: Setup OAuth provider, Create user model, Build login endpoint
Verifications: Task 1 - Pass (OAuth configured), Task 2 - Pass (model tests), Task 3 - Pass (endpoint tested)
Ready for feedback before proceeding to next batch.

best_practices: Start with a clear, detailed plan document before using this skill
Keep batch sizes small for complex or high-risk changes (1-2 tasks)
Always wait for user feedback at checkpoints before continuing
Stop immediately when blockers or unclear instructions are encountered
anti_patterns: Forcing through verification failures without investigation
Skipping checkpoints to complete work faster
Batching too many tasks when tests are unreliable

faq.question: Does this skill create implementation plans?
faq.answer: No. This skill executes existing plans. Use the writing-plans skill to create plans first.

faq.question: What happens if verification fails?
faq.answer: The skill reports the failure and stops. You must investigate and fix the issue before continuing.

faq.question: Can I change batch size mid-execution?
faq.answer: Yes. Simply specify the new batch size when requesting the next batch. Smaller batches work better for complex tasks.

faq.question: Is my code and data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: This is a prompt-only skill. It reads plan documents you provide and executes work you approve. No data leaves your environment.

faq.question: How does this integrate with other skills?
faq.answer: Works with test-driven-development for test-first implementation, systematic-debugging when issues arise, and code-review after significant batches.

faq.question: What distinguishes this from running tasks directly?
faq.answer: The skill enforces systematic execution with checkpoints, verification requirements, and progress reporting. This prevents accumulating errors and ensures quality.
